links: https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=bDnnAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA22#v=onepage&q&f=false |page=22 |date=2014 |publisher=Oxford University Press |isbn=9780199685424 |quote=Although the basic philosophy behind the law of military occupation is that it is a temporary situation modem occupations have well demonstrated that ''rien ne dure comme le provisoire'' A significant number of post-1945 occupations have lasted more than two decades such as the occupations of Namibia by South Africa and of East Timor by Indonesia as well as the ongoing occupations of Northern Cyprus by Turkey and of Western Sahara by Morocco. The Israeli occupation of the Palestinian territories, <u>which is the longest in all occupation's history</u> has already entered its fifth decade. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150109153918/https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=bDnnAgAAQBAJ&pg=PA22
citation.title: The role of national courts in applying international humanitarian law

wikipedia.title: Israel
wikipedia.summary: Israel, officially the State of Israel, is a country in the Middle East, on the southeastern shore of the Mediterranean Sea and the northern shore of the Red Sea.

wikipedia.title: Palestine (region)
wikipedia.summary: Palestine (,, ;, Palaistinē; ; Hebrew: פלשתינה Palestina) is a geographic region in Western Asia between the Mediterranean Sea and the Jordan River.
